Who are you?

‚ÄúWho are YOU?‚Äù This was not an encouraging opening for a conversation. Alice replied, rather shyly, ‚ÄúI--I hardly know, sir, just at present-- at least I know who I WAS when I got up this morning, but I think I must have been changed several times since then.‚Äù

‚Äï Lewis Carroll, Alice in Wonderland

Imagine

Simple game. Tic-tac-toe.

Choose x or o stone.

Play a round and then your opponent.

Maybe I win, maybe I loose, maybe it's a draw. Winner and looser.

But what if‚Ä¶

‚Ä¶ each round your stone is chosen by a chance? And the same for your playmate.

Who is the winner and who is the looser?

Is there any looser?

Try by yourself.

How did you play?
